entities.name: Monitoring and Reports
observations: Subsection of Policies, Documentation & Support focused on monitoring systems and reporting incidents
Contains GxP Compliance Managed Documents and Service Interruption Reports
Located in the IT Knowledge Base under Operations
Previously categorized as 'Section', now using consolidated 'ContentSection' type

entities.name: GxP Compliance Managed Documents
observations: Collection of documents related to GxP compliance and validation
Includes configuration specifications, qualification documents, SOPs, and change control forms
Documents follow a standardized naming convention and approval process
Used to track and manage GxP compliance efforts at Schr√∂dinger
Documents follow a standardized naming convention with prefixes indicating document type (e.g., BOX-CS, BOX-IQ, SOP-IT, IT-CCF)
Documents have version control and effective dates to track changes over time
Approval process involves multiple stakeholders including Business Owner, IT System Owner, and Quality Assurance
Documents are stored in Box with separate links for editable and final versions
New controlled documents can be created from a template in Confluence
Documents are labeled with 'managed_doc' and 'GxP' tags for organization and filtering

entities.name: Service Interruption Reports
observations: Collection of reports documenting service outages and interruptions
Reports follow a standardized template with executive summary, background, incident description, and analysis
Includes chronology of events, detection methods, response actions, and mitigation strategies
Reports are reviewed by a Service Interruption Review Board (SIRB)
Outstanding actions and reports are tracked separately
Reports are named with date and affected system, e.g., 'ITLC 2024-03-13 SIR for bolt stuck_jobs.cron'
Reports include detailed chronology of events with timestamps to track incident progression
Analysis sections focus on detection methods, response time, communication effectiveness, and prevention strategies
Reports are created from a standardized template accessible from the main SIR page
Historical reports (prior to Confluence implementation) were stored in Google Drive
Reports are labeled with relevant tags to make them searchable and categorizable

entities.name: Box GxP
observations: GxP-compliant Box implementation used at Schr√∂dinger
Subject to validation through various qualification documents
Has configuration specifications, installation qualification, and validation protocols
Changes are tracked through change control forms
Box implementation that complies with Good Practice (GxP) regulations for regulated industries
Validated through multiple qualification documents including CS-001 (Configuration Specification), IQ-001 (Installation Qualification), and others
Changes to the system are tracked through Change Control Forms (CCFs) with specific approval workflows
System is governed by Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) that define validation and compliance requirements
Documentation includes links to the actual files stored in Box for reference

entities.name: Configuration Specification

Requires approval from Business Owner, IT System Owner, and Quality Assurance
Stored in Box with specific links for editable and final versions
Previously categorized as 'DocumentType', now using consolidated 'DocumentType' meta-entity

Part of the validation process for GxP systems
Requires approval from Business Owner, IT System Owner, and Quality Assurance
Previously categorized as 'DocumentType', now using consolidated 'DocumentType' meta-entity

Includes information about the change, affected system, tickets, and approval status
Links to editable, approved, and final versions of the change documentation

Example: ITLC SOP-IT-001 for GxP Computer System Validation

entities.name: Service Interruption Review Board
observations: Team responsible for reviewing Service Interruption Reports (SIRs)
Holds regular meetings to discuss and analyze service outages
Tracks outstanding actions and reports
Ensures lessons learned are implemented to prevent future incidents
Meeting notes are documented in the IT Knowledge Base
Board began reviewing completed SIRs starting July 14, 2022 according to documented procedures
Meetings are documented with standardized notes created from a template
Reviews focus on identifying root causes and preventive measures for future incidents
Board maintains lists of outstanding actions and reports to ensure follow-up
Meeting notes are organized chronologically in the IT Knowledge Base

entities.name: SIR Template
observations: Standardized template for creating Service Interruption Reports
Includes sections for executive summary, background, incident description, and analysis
Contains fields for outage scope, dates, tickets, and responsible parties
Provides structure for chronology, detection, response, mitigation, and avoidance
Includes next actions section for tracking follow-up items

entities.name: SIR Outstanding Actions
observations: Document tracking follow-up actions from Service Interruption Reports
Lists actions that need to be completed to prevent similar incidents
Referenced in the main Service Interruption Reports page
Helps ensure accountability for implementing improvements

entities.name: SIR Outstanding Reports
observations: Document tracking Service Interruption Reports that need to be completed
Lists incidents that require formal documentation and analysis
Referenced in the main Service Interruption Reports page
Helps ensure all significant incidents are properly documented

entities.name: Bolt Cluster
observations: High-performance computing cluster at Schr√∂dinger
Subject of multiple Service Interruption Reports
Example incident: stuck_jobs.cron issue in March 2024
Critical system for computational workloads
High-performance computing cluster that experienced an incident in March 2024 with the stuck_jobs.cron script
Issue involved a script intended to clear stuck jobs that was incorrectly killing active processes
Incident was detected through user reports in Google Chat
Resolution involved disabling and removing the problematic script through configuration management (ansible)
Incident highlighted the need for better testing of legacy scripts and improved monitoring
Previously categorized as 'ComputeSystem', now using consolidated 'ComputeResource' type

entities.name: ITLC 2024-03-13 SIR for bolt stuck_jobs.cron
observations: Service Interruption Report for an incident with the Bolt cluster on March 12, 2024
Associated with JIRA ticket ITHPC-825
Issue involved a script for clearing stuck jobs that was incorrectly killing active processes
Script was deployed through configuration management (ansible) and ran every 4 hours
Problem was detected through user reports in Google Chat
Resolution involved disabling and removing the problematic script
Incident highlighted the need for better testing of legacy scripts
Previously categorized as 'ServiceInterruptionReport', now using 'DocumentType' with subtype 'ServiceInterruptionReport'

Document link available in the Confluence page: confluence_content/IT Knowledge Base/üõ†Ô∏è Operations/üìö Support, Policies & Documentation/üìä Monitoring and Reports/ITLC Service Interruption Reports (SIR)/ITLC 2024-03-13 SIR for bolt stuck_jobs.cron

entities.name: Content Organization
observations: This entity describes the consolidation of entityTypes in the knowledge graph
Section and Subsection can be consolidated into ContentSection with a hierarchical relationship
DocumentType can be used as a parent category for specific document types
HPCCluster and ComputeSystem can be consolidated to ComputeResource
Authentication-related types can be consolidated under AuthenticationComponent
Software-related types can be consolidated under SoftwareComponent

entities.name: Relation Organization
observations: This entity describes the consolidation of relationTypes in the knowledge graph
'contains' and 'includes' can be consolidated to 'contains'
'documents', 'documents incidents for', and 'documents incident for' can be consolidated to 'documents'
'configures', 'validates', 'governs', and 'tracks changes to' can be consolidated under 'manages'
'manages' and 'schedules' can be consolidated to 'manages'

entities.name: ContentSection
observations: A consolidated entity type that represents sections and subsections in the knowledge base
Replaces the separate 'Section' and 'Subsection' entity types
Can be organized hierarchically with parent-child relationships
Used for organizing content in the IT Knowledge Base

entities.name: DocumentType
observations: A consolidated entity type that represents various types of documents
Parent category for specific document types like ConfigurationSpecification, InstallationQualification, etc.
Used for categorizing and organizing documentation in the knowledge base

entities.name: ComputeResource
observations: A consolidated entity type that represents computing resources
Replaces 'HPCCluster' and 'ComputeSystem' entity types
Used for describing high-performance computing resources and systems

entities.name: AuthenticationComponent
observations: A consolidated entity type that represents authentication-related components
Replaces 'AuthenticationSystem', 'AuthenticationMethod', and 'AuthenticationTool' entity types
Used for describing various aspects of authentication and security

entities.name: SoftwareComponent
observations: A consolidated entity type that represents software-related components
Replaces 'SoftwareCategory' and 'SoftwareApplication' entity types
Used for describing various types of software and applications

entities.name: HPC Infrastructure
observations: High Performance Computing infrastructure at Schr√∂dinger
Includes multiple clusters: bolt and pdxgpu
Supports computational workloads for research and development
Managed through job schedulers: Slurm and Grid Engine

entities.name: Bolt Cluster Architecture
observations: Flagship HPC cluster at Schr√∂dinger
Contains over 1000 Pascal generation GPUs (expanding to 3000)
Has 2000 Intel Skylake CPU cores
Includes 125 GPU Compute Nodes (bolt-0-*) with Nvidia GeForce GTX1080 GPUs
Includes 250 GPU Compute Nodes (bolt-2-*) with Nvidia GeForce GTX1080Ti GPUs
Includes 4 CPU Compute Nodes (bolt-1-*) with dual 10-core CPUs
Includes 50 CPU Compute Nodes (bolt-3-*) with dual Intel Xeon Gold 6148 CPUs
Has 2 Interactive Submission Nodes (boltsub1, boltsub2)
Has 1 Data Transfer Node (boltio)
Has 1 Master Node (bolt)
Storage: Four node Qc-107 Qumulo cluster (~270TB total)
Contains over 1000 Pascal generation GPUs (expanding to 3000) and 2000 Intel Skylake CPU cores
Includes 125 GPU Compute Nodes (bolt-0-*) with Nvidia GeForce GTX1080 GPUs, 32GB RAM, and ~400GB SSD scratch space
Includes 250 GPU Compute Nodes (bolt-2-*) with Nvidia GeForce GTX1080Ti GPUs, 64GB RAM, and ~840GB SSD scratch space
Includes 4 CPU Compute Nodes (bolt-1-*) with dual 10-core CPUs, 126GB RAM
Includes 50 CPU Compute Nodes (bolt-3-*) with dual Intel Xeon Gold 6148 CPUs, 192GB RAM, and 932GB SSD scratch space
Has 2 Interactive Submission Nodes (boltsub1, boltsub2) with dual 10-core CPUs, 128GB RAM, and 840GB SSD scratch space
Has 1 Data Transfer Node (boltio) with dual 10-core CPUs, 128GB RAM, and 672GB scratch space
Has 1 Master Node (bolt) with dual 10-core CPUs and 126GB RAM

entities.name: PDX GPU Cluster Architecture
observations: Restricted HPC cluster for QA and select developers
Contains 34 GPU cards across 9 GPU compute nodes with varying configurations
Has 2 non-GPU compute nodes for master jobs
Has 1 interactive submission node
Has 1 master node
Shares storage with bob
Runs CentOS 6.5 operating system
Uses SGE 2011.11p1 queuing system
Includes various GPU types: Tesla K20, Tesla K40, Tesla M2090, Nvidia GTX 680, Nvidia Tesla K80
Used for testing and validation of code on different GPU architectures
Runs automated STU tests to ensure code works on all supported GPUs
Restricted cluster for QA and select developers
Includes nodes with Tesla K20, Tesla K40, Tesla M2090, Nvidia GTX 680, and Nvidia Tesla K80 GPUs
Has 1 interactive submission node (pdxgpusub1) with dual 16-core AMD Opteron 6274 CPUs and 64GB RAM
Has 1 master node (pdxgpu)

entities.name: Slurm Scheduler
observations: Modern, highly scalable Linux cluster scheduler
Used on some Schr√∂dinger HPC clusters
Features simple configuration, fault-tolerance, and plugin-based architecture
Powers many top supercomputers
Main commands: sbatch (submit batch jobs), srun (run parallel commands), scancel (cancel jobs)
Provides detailed job monitoring and resource allocation
Supports various job scheduling algorithms including fair-share
Simple configuration, fault-tolerant, plugin-based architecture
Also includes squeue (check job status), sacct (view job history), sinfo (view partitions)
Uses partitions (similar to queues) to organize compute resources

entities.name: Grid Engine Scheduler
observations: Mature batch-queuing system (formerly Sun Grid Engine)
Used on some Schr√∂dinger HPC clusters, specifically pdxgpu
Variants include Oracle, Univa, and open-source Son of Grid Engine
Complex but highly customizable for heterogeneous environments
Main commands: qsub (submit batch jobs), qstat (check job status), qdel (cancel jobs)
Supports various job scheduling algorithms
Used at Schr√∂dinger in the Univa Grid Engine (UGE) iteration
At Schr√∂dinger, using the Univa Grid Engine (UGE) iteration
Also includes qlogin (get interactive session), qconf (view configuration)
Uses queues to organize compute resources
Requires specifying complex values via the -l flag

entities.name: HPC Quick Tips
observations: Section of the HPC User Guide providing essential tips for using HPC clusters
Includes tips for running FEP calculations
Provides practical advice for efficient use of HPC resources

entities.name: Getting Started and Passwordless SSH
observations: Section of the HPC User Guide explaining how to connect to clusters
Provides instructions for setting up passwordless SSH
Essential for new users to access HPC resources

entities.name: Job Server
observations: Section of the HPC User Guide about the Job Server system
Introduced in April 2021
Provides information about job control and management

entities.name: Builds, Releases, and Hosts File
observations: Section of the HPC User Guide explaining software builds and releases
Provides information on configuring the Schrodinger hosts file
Essential for accessing different software versions on the clusters

entities.name: Project Priorities
observations: Section of the HPC User Guide explaining project-based scheduling
Describes how job priorities are determined
Important for understanding job scheduling order

entities.name: Queues
observations: Section of the HPC User Guide describing different queue types
Explains queue properties and usage
Essential for selecting appropriate resources for jobs

entities.name: Storage and Quotas
observations: Section of the HPC User Guide about managing storage
Explains storage quotas on the clusters
Provides information on available storage resources

entities.name: Slurm Commands
observations: Collection of commands used to interact with the Slurm scheduler
Includes sbatch (submit batch jobs), srun (run parallel commands), scancel (cancel jobs)
Also includes squeue (check job status), sacct (view job history), sinfo (view partitions)
Essential for managing jobs on Slurm-based clusters like bolt

entities.name: Grid Engine Commands
observations: Collection of commands used to interact with the Grid Engine scheduler
Includes qsub (submit batch jobs), qstat (check job status), qdel (cancel jobs)
Also includes qlogin (get interactive session), qconf (view configuration)
Essential for managing jobs on Grid Engine-based clusters like pdxgpu

entities.name: Job Scheduling Concepts
observations: Fundamental concepts related to job scheduling in HPC environments
Includes resource allocation, job priorities, queues/partitions
Explains how schedulers make decisions about job execution order
Covers scheduling algorithms like first-in-first-out and fair-share

entities.name: Slurm Partitions
observations: Groups of nodes in Slurm with specific properties
Similar to queues in other scheduling systems
Examples include cpu.q (for CPU jobs) and cuda.q (for GPU jobs)
Jobs are submitted to specific partitions based on resource requirements

entities.name: Grid Engine Queues
observations: Groups of nodes in Grid Engine with specific properties
Examples include nongpu.q (for CPU jobs) and cuda.q (for GPU jobs)
Jobs are submitted to specific queues based on resource requirements
Often require specifying complex values via the -l flag

Part of the Services, Software & Applications section
Contains child pages with more detailed information

entities.name: Storage, Archives & Backups Section

entities.name: Knowledge Graph Consolidation
observations: Summary of the consolidation and enhancement work done on the knowledge graph
Consolidated entityTypes: Section and Subsection into ContentSection
Consolidated entityTypes: HPCCluster and ComputeSystem into ComputeResource
Consolidated entityTypes: AuthenticationSystem, AuthenticationMethod, and AuthenticationTool into AuthenticationComponent
Consolidated entityTypes: SoftwareCategory and SoftwareApplication into SoftwareComponent
Consolidated relationTypes: 'contains' and 'includes' into 'contains'
Consolidated relationTypes: 'documents', 'documents incidents for', and 'documents incident for' into 'documents'
Consolidated relationTypes: 'configures', 'validates', 'governs', and 'tracks changes to' into 'manages'
Consolidated relationTypes: 'manages' and 'schedules' into 'manages'
Added new entities and relations based on content from the confluence_content directory
Enhanced the knowledge graph with detailed information about HPC infrastructure, office locations, hardware, software, and support channels

entities.name: EntityType Consolidation Update
observations: This entity describes additional consolidation of entityTypes in the knowledge graph
Document-related types (ConfigurationSpecification, InstallationQualification, StandardOperatingProcedure, ChangeControlForm, ServiceInterruptionReport) should all be subtypes of DocumentType
This consolidation builds upon the previous work described in the Content Organization entity

entities.name: RelationType Consolidation Update
observations: This entity describes additional consolidation of relationTypes in the knowledge graph
'has instance' and 'contains' (when referring to documents) can be consolidated to 'contains'
'reviewed by' can be consolidated to 'managedBy'
'tracks with' can be consolidated to 'uses'
'describes' and 'documents' can be consolidated to 'documents'
This consolidation builds upon the previous work described in the Relation Organization entity

entities.name: Service Interruption Report Template
observations: Standardized template for creating Service Interruption Reports
Includes sections for executive summary, background, incident description, chronology, corrective action, and analysis
Also includes sections for detection, response, mitigation, avoidance, and next actions
Used to document service outages and interruptions in a consistent format
Helps track incidents, their causes, and follow-up actions

entities.name: Service Interruption Review Board Operation
observations: Process for reviewing completed Service Interruption Reports
Started on July 14, 2022
Involves regular meetings to discuss and analyze service outages
Tracks outstanding actions and reports
Ensures lessons learned are implemented to prevent future incidents

entities.name: License Server
observations: Computer software system that provides access tokens or keys to client computers
Enables licensed software to run
Used for Schr√∂dinger Suite and some third-party software
Critical service for software users
Requires monitoring for disk space, load, and service health

entities.name: NYC License Server
observations: License server located in NYC (nyc-lic-lv01)
Virtual machine providing FLEXlm license services
Used for Schr√∂dinger Suite and third-party software from Intel and TotalView
Critical service for software users in NYC
Experienced an outage on September 19, 2022 due to disk space issues

entities.name: ITLC 2022-09-19 SIR for NYC License Server
observations: Service Interruption Report for NYC License Server outage on September 19, 2022
Issue: High load and / filesystem 100% full
Resolution: Freeing space and restarting license manager services
Root cause: Large log files in /var/log/flexlm/ filling up disk space
Detection: User reports in IT Support Hotline
Recommended improvements: Monitor disk space, rotate log files, monitor service health

Document link available in the Confluence page: confluence_content/IT Knowledge Base/üõ†Ô∏è Operations/üìö Support, Policies & Documentation/üìä Monitoring and Reports/ITLC Service Interruption Reports (SIR)/ITLC 2022-09-19 SIR for NYC License Server

entities.name: GxP Compliance Program
observations: Internal program at Schr√∂dinger for GxP compliance
Requires tracking the status of various documents associated with compliance efforts
Includes configuration specifications, installation qualifications, and standard operating procedures
Documents follow a standardized naming convention and approval process
Documents are stored in Box with links to editable and final versions

entities.name: Managed Document Numbering and Naming
observations: Convention for numbering and naming GxP compliance documents
Prefixes indicate document type (e.g., BOX-CS, BOX-IQ, SOP-IT)
Documents have version control and effective dates
Helps ensure consistent documentation and tracking of GxP compliance efforts

entities.name: Knowledge Graph Analysis Summary
observations: Comprehensive analysis of the confluence_content directory to enhance the knowledge graph
Identified and consolidated similar entityTypes: Section and Subsection into ContentSection, HPCCluster and ComputeSystem into ComputeResource, etc.
Consolidated relationTypes: 'contains' and 'includes' into 'contains', 'documents incidents for' and 'documents incident for' into 'documents', etc.
Added detailed information about HPC infrastructure, including Bolt and PDX GPU cluster architectures
Added information about schedulers (Slurm and Grid Engine) and their commands
Added information about Service Interruption Reports and their structure
Added information about GxP Compliance Managed Documents and their types
Added information about Software & Applications, Cloud Infrastructure, and Storage Solutions
Created a more interconnected knowledge graph with meaningful relations between entities
Identified areas for further enhancement, such as adding more Service Interruption Reports and GxP documents

entities.name: Additional RelationType Consolidation
observations: This entity describes additional opportunities for consolidating relationTypes in the knowledge graph
'isA' and 'isVersionOf' could be consolidated to a more general 'isA' relation
'references', 'documents', and 'describes' could be consolidated to 'documents'
'follows' and 'uses' could potentially be consolidated to 'uses'
'provides' and 'supports' could potentially be consolidated to 'provides'
'implements' and 'follows' could potentially be consolidated to 'implements'
These consolidations would further simplify the knowledge graph while maintaining its semantic meaning
